page.title: 12LIVING HERE IS NICE BUT ...
page.content: Most people are content with living in the village but many complain of apathy and lack of village spirit. Some older residents feel that life was better when the village was run by the Cripps family. There is a certain resentment against newcomers who seem to be turning the village into middle class suburbia. Social divisiveness shows itself in fund-raising activities - buffet suppers v. jumble sales. People complain of the lack of village activities especially for young people, but volunteers to help are very hard to find. Those who do organise things often become dispirited through lack of support. At least 12 open occasions have taken place in the school in the last 18 months yet 60 village people have not been inside the school apart from using it for polling at elections.
